intro: Schefflera barteri var. urostachya, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its compound leaves with numerous leaflets arranged in a radiating pattern, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by small, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a notable species within the Araliaceae family.
